TopicTitle: What’s the first thing you’ll do in ksp2?

Articles.Content:
What’s going to be the first thing you do in ksp2? I think what I’m going to do is push the game to it’s limitations, see just how badly it can be broken..Maybe will make an orion drive pogo stick...

Or start a dedicated game and play the gane the way it’s intended to. Either way, the sky is the limit!

(I’ll excuse myself out....)

Edited November 18, 2020 by Lewie
Crash.
Actually take time to make a satellite network
Good idea...I still have to do that in ksp...

I'd like to try the new "Progression" mode and do a spoiler-free playthrough exploring all the bodies on my own accord without consulting this forum. I think that's the best way to challenge and delight myself. Looking forward to unlocking the Daedalus drive. Then, I'm going to get work modding to my heart's content.

Edited May 5, 2020 by prestja
Install the program, go to settings, and max them out. That's what I do with every new game I install...

Sandbox, most powerful engine, minimal fuel tank, command chair, Jeb. Throttle up, space bar.

 

Then start a career mod game.

orion drive on the pad just for annual launch pad durability tests.

In Sandbox, make a Mun land-and-return ship and fly it, tweaking until I succeed with the Kerbals home.

Then I'm going to look into modding.
Play the tutorials.
Probably gonna either see if Orion drives are better for kerbal cannons than vectors, or try to build an SSTA before anyone else.
Crash, Either to desktop or with a rocket. Probably both
Explore whats possible in multiplayer mode. Looking forward to doing missions with friends.

Go to the settings, set the Max delta time per frame to 0.12 and install timecontrol and increase it MOAR

 

And decrease all of the graphic settings to their lowest

Progression save, Horizon Munar Colony as soon as possible and then launching all other missions from there, maybe while keeping o or 2 mun capable sstos as Kerbin Landers.
